com.poesys.db.connection

Class ConnectionFactoryFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.poesys.db.connection.ConnectionFactoryFactory

  • public class ConnectionFactoryFactory
extends java.lang.Object

    Creates and caches singleton database connection factories for subsystems. Each factory becomes a singleton in the cache, mapped by subsystem name. The class provides methods to create subsystem factories, to get those factories, and to restart the factories (clearing any caches or connections in the subsystem factory).

    The database properties bundle sets the default subsystem and a default DBMS for each subsystem.

    Author:
    Robert J. Muller
    See Also:
    IConnectionFactory

    • Method Detail

      • initializeSubsystem

        private static void initializeSubsystem(java.lang.String subsystem,
                                        IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        InvalidParametersException
        Initialize a specific subsystem if no such subsystem exists, creating the factory and setting the mapped instance for the subsystem name.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the subsystem to create, if necessary
        dbms - the type of DBMS the subsystem uses
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem initializing the subsystem
        InvalidParametersException - if the subsystem string is null or empty

      • getDbms

        public static IConnectionFactory.DBMS getDbms(java.lang.String subsystem)
        Get the DBMS for a specified subsystem from the subsystem database properties. If the specified subsystem is null, the method returns the DBMS for the default subsystem in the database properties file. Note that the initializeSubsystem() method accesses this DBMS value only if it gets a null passed in for DBMS. You can use this DBMS value to test for the underlying DBMS for a subsystem even when the application is using DBMS.JNDI or something similar, obscuring the actual DBMS with a software layer that configures the underlying DBMS.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the subsystem for which to get the DBMS; may be null
        Returns:
        the DBMS from the subsystem properties

      • initializeCache

        private static void initializeCache()
        Initialize the internal cache of subsystem connection factories.

      • getInstance

        public static IConnectionFactory getInstance(IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms)
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             InvalidParametersException
        Get the singleton instance of the default connection factory. The factory must produce connections for the specified DBMS and should implement a connection pool if specified.
        Parameters:
        dbms - the kind of DBMS
        Returns:
        the default singleton connection factory instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is a problem initializing the subsystem
        InvalidParametersException - if the subsystem string is null or empty

      • getInstance

        public static IConnectionFactory getInstance(java.lang.String subsystem,
                                             IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms)
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             InvalidParametersException
        Get the singleton instance of the connection factory for a specific subsystem given the DBMS.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the name of the subsystem factory to get, such as "com.poesys.test.mysql.writer"
        dbms - the optional type of DBMS the subsystem uses
        Returns:
        a connection factory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem reading the resource bundle
        InvalidParametersException - when the subsystem string is null or empty

      • getInstance

        public static IConnectionFactory getInstance(java.lang.String subsystem)
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             InvalidParametersException
        Get the singleton instance of the connection factory for a specific subsystem. The DBMS is set either by an already-cached factory for the subsystem or from the properties file.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the name of the subsystem factory to get, such as "com.poesys.test.mysql.writer"
        Returns:
        a connection factory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem reading the resource bundle
        InvalidParametersException - when the subsystem string is null or empty

      • restart

        public static void restart(java.lang.String subsystem,
                           IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           InvalidParametersException,
                           ConnectionException
        Restart the singleton instance of the connection factory. This method resets the connection parameters to whatever they are in their property file. The method takes a string that is the subsystem prefix for the properties in the property file. If no factory instance exists, this method creates one. The method will clear any existing cache of the data source and connection pool.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the property string representing the subsystem
        dbms - the type of DBMS to restart
        Throws:
        InvalidParametersException - when the subsystem string is null or empty
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem reading the resource bundle
        ConnectionException - when there is a problem getting a connection

      • close

        public static void close(java.lang.String subsystem,
                         IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms)
                  throws InvalidParametersException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         ConnectionException
        Close the subsystem's factory for a DBMS.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the subsystem for which to close the DBMS factory
        dbms - the DBMS to close
        Throws:
        InvalidParametersException - when the subsystem string is null or empty
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem reading the resource bundle
        ConnectionException - when there is a problem getting a connection

      • initialize

        protected static void initialize(java.lang.String subsystem,
                                 IConnectionFactory.DBMS dbms)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 InvalidParametersException
        Get the properties required to initialize the instance from the database.properties file and initialize the instance. If for some reason the subsystem doesn't exist in the map, the method will create an instance.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the property string representing the subsystem
        dbms - the type of DBMS the subsystem uses
        Throws:
        InvalidParametersException - when the subsystem string is null or empty or the port is not an integer number
        java.io.IOException - when there is a problem reading the resource bundle

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the service name, if any

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the database name, if any

      • isJndi

        public static boolean isJndi(java.lang.String subsystem)
        Determine whether the JNDI name is available. You can use this method to decide whether to use a JNDI delegate or a JDBC delegate.
        Parameters:
        subsystem - the subsystem
        Returns:
        true if the subsystem JNDI name is operational, false if not

        Returns:
